page.title: 17COULARDBANK ESTATE LOSSIE
page.content: The Coulardbank Estate was built in the 1980s. It is a council estate which includes 40 RAF houses.The land that the houses are built on is badly drained and some houses have a problem with dampness. Some people have had to move out because of it. A main road goes round the estate and all the houses are in groups off the main road. These streets are all on the Coulardbank estate: Bailey Place, Rockall Place, Fairisle Place, Forties Place, and Cromarty Place are all shipping areas, Shackleton Place is named after the RAF plane. A lot of playspace is provided in the estate with play equipment. There are few other facilities and no garages, although there are big carparks. The bus service has been improved with 6 stops in Coulardbank.
